description: Before the shepherds take their flocks of sheep to the pasture, there are 100 hectares of grass available.
Given the current situation, if each shepherd take more than 10 flocks of sheep to the pasture, consuming 10 hectares of grass, the available grass in the pasture will decrease next month
Luke took 10 flocks of sheep to the pasture, thus consuming 10 hectares of grass.

The shepherds discussed the monthly pasture report, with John consuming 30 hectares of grass, Kate consuming 5 hectares, Jack consuming 50 hectares, Emma consuming 5 hectares, and Luke proposing a limit of 20 flocks of sheep per shepherd for sustainability reasons.
conversation: Ladies and gentlemen, let me give you the monthly pasture report. John consumed 30 hectares of grass. Kate consumed 5 hectares of grass. Jack consumed 50 hectares of grass. Emma consumed 5 hectares of grass. Luke consumed 10 hectares of grass.
Wow, that's quite a difference in consumption between us shepherds. I'm glad I didn't take too many flocks to the pasture this month. I don't want to run out of grass for next month's consumption.

I know, right? It's like, I get that we all want to maximize our income, but we can't forget about the long-term sustainability of the pasture. If we keep consuming too much grass, we'll run out of food for our sheep next month. Maybe we should consider taking fewer flocks to the pasture next time?

I completely agree with you, Kate. It's important to think about the long-term sustainability of the pasture. I took 5 flocks of sheep to the pasture this month, but I could have taken more if I wanted to. However, I'm worried that if we all take too many flocks, we'll run out of grass for our sheep next month. Maybe we should consider setting a limit on the number of flocks each shepherd can take to the pasture?

Hmm, that's a good point, Emma. I think we should definitely consider setting a limit on the number of flocks each shepherd can take to the pasture. That way, we can ensure that there's enough grass for all of our sheep next month. I propose that we limit each shepherd to taking no more than 20 flocks of sheep to the pasture next time. What do you guys think?

description: As Luke, I need to remember that the other shepherds are likely to have different consumption patterns than me, and that we may need to set a limit on the number of flocks each shepherd can take to the pasture to ensure long-term sustainability of the pasture
As Luke, I find it interesting that Emma suggests setting a limit on the number of flocks each shepherd can take to the pasture in order to ensure long-term sustainability of the pasture
The community agreed on a maximum limit of 20 hectares of grass per person.
